message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CY, cs.SI

This paper discusses the role of Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Machine Learning (ML) in shaping societal biases and stereotypes, specifically related to gender bias. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with NLP and related topics. 

The paper also discusses methods to recognize and mitigate gender bias in NLP, which falls under the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). 

Since the paper discusses the success and limitations of existing methods, it may also fall under the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). 

The paper also discusses the societal impact of gender bias in NLP, which may fall under the sub-category of cs.CY (Computers and Society). 

Finally, the paper discusses future studies for recognizing and mitigating gender bias in NLP, which may fall under the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
